question: Which of the following statements is most accurate?
subject: Technical

question: If a 50000 Ibf aircraft requires 25000 lbf of thrust maintain unaccelerated straight and level flight at 250 Kts what is its L:D ratio?
subject: Technical

question: What effect does increasing load factor have on power required at any given aircraft weight and TAS?

choices.choice: Increases in direct proportion to load factor.
Decreases in direct proportion to load factor.
Power required is inversely proportional to load factor.

subject: Technical

question: What effect will increasing weight have on DI, Dp and DTotal at any given load factor and airspeed?
subject: Technical

question: What effect will increasing aircraft weight have on minimum drag speed (VMD) and speed stability.
subject: Technical

question: What effect will lowering the landing gear have on VMD and speed stability?
subject: Technical

question: What is the effect on D1 and Dp when an aircraft climbs to altitude at constant low IAS .
subject: Technical

question: What would be the effect on Dl, Dp and speed stability if the trailing edge flaps of an aircraft were lowered to the 10 degree setting while maintaining constant speed and wings level?
subject: Technical

question: What would be the effect on Dl, Dp and speed stability if the trailing edge flaps of an aircraft were lowered to the 40 degree setting while maintaining constant speed and wings level?
subject: Technical

question: What will be the effect on drag if humidity is increased if air temperature, pressure and TAS remain constant?

choices.choice: Decrease or increase depending on Mach number.

subject: Technical

question: When flying at best L:D ratio what is the ratio of Dp: Dl?
subject: Technical

question: Which of the following occur at VMD?

choices.choice: Minimum power required and best L:D ratio.
Minimum drag and greatest L:D ratio.
Minimum angle of attack and best rate of climb.
Minimum drag and greatest jet propeller aircraft range.

subject: Technical

question: In what direction does the drag force act?

choices.choice: Parallel but opposite to the direction of flight.

subject: Technical

question: Which of the following statements are true of the total reaction generated by a wing flying at zero lift angle of attack.
subject: Technical

question: In what direction does the total reaction act when a wing is flying at its zero lift angle of attack?

choices.choice: Parallel but opposite to the direction of flight.
Vertically aft through the C of G.
Vertically upward through the aerodynamic centre
Vertically aft such that it produces a nose up pitching moment.

subject: Technical

question: What is the relationship between Dl and Dp at speeds below VMD?
subject: Technical

question: Complete the following statement. As airspeed changes from VMO to CLMax ……………. increases and ………….. decreases.
subject: Technical

question: Which of the following definitions of Dp is the most accurate?

choices.choice: It is made up of form, friction and induced drag.
It is made up of friction, induced and shock drag.
It is made up of friction, form and interference drag.
It is made up of interference, shock and form drag.

subject: Technical

question: Which of the following statements concerning the generation of lift is most accurate?

choices.choice: Lift is generated by a cambered aerofoil.
Lift is generated by an aerofoil at a positive angle.
Lift is generated by high speed airflow.
Lift is generated by the downward acceleration of air.

subject: Technical

question: Which of the following causes induced drag (Dl)?

choices.choice: Shock waves above and below the wing.
Friction due to the air passing over the wing.
Rotating airflow caused by wing tip vortices.
The upwash of air caused by wingtip vortices.

subject: Technical

question: A model of an aerofoil is placed in a rectangular wind tunnel such that its tips are embedded in the sides of the tunnel. Which of the following statements best represents the flow of air over the aerofoil when it is generating a lift force.

choices.choice: Because the wing effectively has no wingtips there will be no tip vortices and no downwash.
Because the wing is generating lift there will be downwash but this will be reduced by the effective lack of wingtips.
Downwash will not be reduced by the lack of wingtips.
The wing is effectively tw"o dimensional so its CL:a curve will be vertical. It will therefore produce no induced drag.

subject: Technical

question: If it were possible to build and fly a wing of infinite length how much downwash would it create and what would be the shape of its CL:a curve?
subject: Technical

question: Which of the following is responsible for the creation of induced drag?

choices.choice: Angle of attack, camber, wing area and airspeed.
Pitch angle, camber, wing area and airspeed.
Pitch angle, camber, wing area and angle of attack.
Airspeed, wing area and pitch angle.

subject: Technical

choices.choice: At right angles to the flight path.

At right angles to the relative airflow.

Decreased induced drag due to less efficient lift production.
Increased profile drag and greater speed stability.
Decreased profile drag and lower speed stability.

question: What causes wing tip vortices?

High pressure air leaking from below the wings.

Spanwise flow from root to tip above the wings.

Increases approximately with the square of speed.
Decreases approximately with the inverse of the square of speed.

Gives best range in a jet aircraft.
